rooms.description: Open space combining entrance, living area, and informal dining. Designed with large exposed concrete surfaces for a Brutalist aesthetic. Large windows on the east side to allow morning sunlight following Vastu principles.
Modern kitchen integrated with a small dining area. The design incorporates functional storage and a large window facing the north for adequate ventilation, aligning with local building norms.
Multi-functional bedroom that doubles as living space when needed. Incorporates built-in storage solutions to maximize space in a single-story studio setting.
Dedicated home office with soundproofing and ample natural light from windows on the south, following Vastu recommendations for focus and productivity.
Fully equipped private gym with mirrored walls and high ceilings to enhance workout performance. Ventilation is ensured via large openings in the west side.
Essential space for appliances, storage, and laundry facilities, designed to maintain the Brutalist minimalistic design with functional exposed materials.

openings.description: Large windows to let in morning sunlight and provide natural ventilation.
Sturdy door with metal framing to match the Brutalist aesthetic while ensuring security.
Windows in home office and living area for optimal natural light.
Access to the private rooftop terrace. Provides additional outdoor living space.
